Adult.description: Band-tailed Pigeons have a white crescent on the neck and a pale tip to the tail unlike the dark-tipped tail on Rock Pigeons. Band-tailed Pigeons occur more often in forested areas than in towns like Rock Pigeons.
Mourning Doves are smaller than Rock Pigeons and have a longer, pointier tail. They are tan overall rather than gray like the Rock Pigeon.

Adult/immature.description: Eurasian Collared-Doves are smaller than Rock Pigeons, with a longer, square-tipped tail. They are uniform sandy brown except for a black collar on the neck.

Adult.description: White-winged Doves are smaller than Rock Pigeons, with a white patch on the wings that is visible both in flight and at rest.
